intro: Vulneraria heterophylla var. parvula, commonly known as the small-leaved woundwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a short lifespan and is often found in disturbed soils. Its name refers to its historical use in treating wounds, though it is not commonly used in modern medicine.
